00001 // ORHeaderDecoder.hh
00002 
00003 #ifndef _ORHeaderDecoder_hh_
00004 #define _ORHeaderDecoder_hh_
00005 
00006 #include "ORVDataDecoder.hh"
00007 #include "ORLogger.hh"
00008 
00009 class ORHeaderDecoder : public ORVDataDecoder
00010 {
00011   public:
00012     enum EOrcaStreamVersion { kOld, kNewUnswapped, kNewSwapped, kUnknownVersion };
00013 
00014     // This query should be made upon reading the first word from a data
00015     // stream. This function will decide whether or not the stream
00016     // is swapped relative to the system. If the record is not a
00017     // header data record, you are screwed.
00018     virtual EOrcaStreamVersion GetStreamVersion(UInt_t firstWordOfStream);
00019 
00020     virtual inline UInt_t FirstWordOldVersion() { return *((UInt_t*) "<?xm"); }
00021     virtual inline UInt_t ExpectedDataId() { return 0x0; }
00022 
00023     virtual bool IsHeader(UInt_t firstWordOfRecord);
00024     virtual inline UInt_t NBytesOf(UInt_t* dataRecord) 
00025       { return sizeof(UInt_t)*LengthOf(dataRecord); }
00026     // Gets number of bytes (including the 8-byte header)
00027 
00028     virtual inline const char* HeaderStringOf(UInt_t* dataRecord) { return (const char*) (dataRecord + 2); }
00029     /* Be careful here, make sure to check the length of the record. */
00030 
00031     virtual void Swap(UInt_t* /*dataRecord*/) {}
00032     /* Don't require a swap for char data. */
00033     virtual std::string GetDataObjectPath() { 
00034       ORLog(kWarning) << "GetDataObjectPath() should not be called for an ORHeaderDecoder! " 
00035                       << "returning an empty string." << std::endl;
00036       return ""; 
00037     }
00038 };
00039 
00040 #endif
